original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this:

original: dper na / nang gi lus zhes bya ba 'di ni ming tsam du tha snyad kyis gdags pa ste /
analyzed: dper na / nang gi lus zhes bya ba 'di ni ming tsam du tha snyad kyis gdags pa ste /
translated: For example, this so-called “inner body” is merely a name, a conventional term.

original: mgo'i rus pa zhes ming du tha snyad kyis gdags pa dang / mjing pa'i rus pa zhes ming du tha snyad kyis gdags pa dang / phrag pa'i rus pa dang / dpung pa'i rus pa dang / tshigs pa'i rus pa dang / rtsib ma'i rus pa dang /🔽dpyi'i rus @122a *//
analyzed: mgo'i rus pa zhes ming du tha snyad kyis gdags pa dang / mjing pa'i rus pa zhes ming du tha snyad kyis gdags pa dang / phrag pa'i rus pa dang / dpung pa'i rus pa dang / tshigs pa'i rus pa dang / rtsib ma'i rus pa dang / dpyi'i rus @122a *//
translated: It is a conventional term for the head bone, a conventional term for the neck bone, a conventional term for the shoulder bone, a conventional term for the arm bone, a conventional term for the rib bone, a conventional term for the spine bone,

original: pa dang / brla'i rus pa dang / rje ngar gyi rus pa dang / rkang pa'i rus pa zhes ming du tha snyad kyis gdags pa de dag kyang /
analyzed: pa dang / brla'i rus pa dang / rje ngar gyi rus pa dang / rkang pa'i rus pa zhes ming du tha snyad kyis gdags pa de dag kyang /
translated: a conventional term for the hip bone, a conventional term for the thigh bone, a conventional term for the knee bone, and a conventional term for the foot bone.

original: chos su gdags ba tsam du zad de /
analyzed: chos su gdags ba tsam du zad de /
translated: Those are merely imputed phenomena.

original: chos su btags pa de la ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: chos su btags pa de la ni 'di lta ste /
translated: As for those imputed phenomena,

original: mgo'i rus pa zhes bya ba dang / rkang pa'i rus pa zhes bya ba'i bar du ming dang brda tsam du tha snyad kyis gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba'am 'gag pa med de /
analyzed: mgo'i rus pa zhes bya ba dang / rkang pa'i rus pa zhes bya ba'i bar du ming dang brda tsam du tha snyad kyis gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba'am 'gag pa med de /
translated: except for the mere designation of names and symbols, such as “head bone” and “foot bone,” there is no arising or ceasing.

original: ming de ni nang na'ang med /
analyzed: ming de ni nang na'ang med /
translated: That name does not exist internally,

original: phyi rol na'ang med /
analyzed: phyi rol na'ang med /
translated: nor does it exist externally,

original: gnyis ka med par yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gnyis ka med par yang mi dmigs so //
translated: nor does it abide between the two, nor is it nonexistent.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du gang 'di shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ming du bya ba dag kyang chos su gdags pa tsam du zad de /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du gang 'di shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ming du bya ba dag kyang chos su gdags pa tsam du zad de /
translated: “Similarly, Su­bhūti, this so-called transcendent perfection of wisdom, this so-called bodhisattva, and this so-called name of a bodhisattva are all merely designations of phenomena.

original: chos su btags pa de la ni ming dang brda tsam du tha snyad kyis gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba'am 'gag pa med de /
analyzed: chos su btags pa de la ni ming dang brda tsam du tha snyad kyis gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba'am 'gag pa med de /
translated: In those designations of phenomena, apart from the mere conventional expressions of names and symbols, there is no arising and no cessation.

original: ming de ni nang na'ang med /
analyzed: ming de ni nang na'ang med /
translated: That name does not exist internally,

original: phyi rol na'ang med /
analyzed: phyi rol na'ang med /
translated: nor does it exist externally,

original: gnyis ka med par yang mi dmigs so //🔽rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gnyis ka med par yang mi dmigs so // rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
translated: nor does it abide between the two, nor is it nonexistent.

original: dper na / gang 'di phyi rol gyi rtsva dang / shing dang / yal ga dang / lo ma dang / 'dab ma zhes bya ba de dag thams cad kyang ming sna tshogs kyis tha snyad du brjod de /
analyzed: dper na / gang 'di phyi rol gyi rtsva dang / shing dang / yal ga dang / lo ma dang / 'dab ma zhes bya ba de dag thams cad kyang ming sna tshogs kyis tha snyad du brjod de /
translated: “Su­bhūti, it is just as, for example, all those external grasses, trees, shrubs, and medicinal plants, which are called by various names, are conventionally expressed by various terms,

original: de dag kyang ming dang brda tsam du tha snyad kyis gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba'am 'gag pa med de /
analyzed: de dag kyang ming dang brda tsam du tha snyad kyis gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba'am 'gag pa med de /
translated: Those are also not produced or stopped except for being verbally designated by names and conventional terms.

original: ming de ni nang na'ang med /
analyzed: ming de ni nang na'ang med /
translated: That name does not exist internally,

original: phyi rol na'ang med /
analyzed: phyi rol na'ang med /
translated: does not exist externally,

original: gnyis ka med par yang mi dmigs @122b so; ;rab 'byor /
analyzed: gnyis ka med par yang mi dmigs @122b so; ;rab 'byor /
translated: and is not apprehended as either of the two.

original: de bzhin du gang 'di shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ming zhes bya ba de dag kyang chos su gdags pa tsam du zad de /
analyzed: de bzhin du gang 'di shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ming zhes bya ba de dag kyang chos su gdags pa tsam du zad de /
translated: “Subhūti, likewise, this so-called perfection of wisdom, this so-called bodhisattva, and this so-called name of a bodhisattva are just designations of a phenomenon.

original: chos su btags pa de la ni ming dang brda tsam du tha snyad kyis gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba'am 'gag pa med de /
analyzed: chos su btags pa de la ni ming dang brda tsam du tha snyad kyis gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba'am 'gag pa med de /
translated: That designation of a phenomenon is not produced or stopped except for being verbally designated by names and conventional terms.

original: ming de ni nang na'ang med /
analyzed: ming de ni nang na'ang med /
translated: That name does not exist internally,

original: phyi rol na'ang med /
analyzed: phyi rol na'ang med /
translated: does not exist externally,

original: gnyis ka med par yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gnyis ka med par yang mi dmigs so //
translated: and is not apprehended as either of the two.

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
translated: “Subhūti, it is like this:

original: dper na / 'das pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi mtshan tsam zhig yod pa'ang /
analyzed: dper na / 'das pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi mtshan tsam zhig yod pa'ang /
translated: buddha bhagavāns exist,

original: mtshan de ni nang na'ang med /🔽phyi rol na'ang med /
analyzed: mtshan de ni nang na'ang med / phyi rol na'ang med /
translated: but those names do not exist internally,

original: gnyis ka med par yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gnyis ka med par yang mi dmigs so //
translated: do not exist externally, and do not abide in between.

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
translated: “Subhūti, it is like this:

original: dper na / rmi lam dang / sgra brnyan dang / gzugs brnyan dang / sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / chu zla dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa'i chos de dag thams cad ni chos su gdags pa tsam du zad de /🔽chos su gtags pa de ni ming dang brda tsam du tha snyad kyis gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba'am /
analyzed: dper na / rmi lam dang / sgra brnyan dang / gzugs brnyan dang / sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / chu zla dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa'i chos de dag thams cad ni chos su gdags pa tsam du zad de / chos su gtags pa de ni ming dang brda tsam du tha snyad kyis gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba'am /
translated: all those phenomena, such as dreams, echoes, optical illusions, magical creations, mirages, moons in the water, and tathāgata emanations, are simply designated as phenomena.

original: 'gag pa med de /
analyzed: 'gag pa med de /
translated: Those phenomena are merely designated by names and symbols, and apart from being designated by conventional terms, they are neither produced nor stopped.

original: ming de ni nang na'ang med /🔽phyi rol na'ang med /
analyzed: ming de ni nang na'ang med / phyi rol na'ang med /
translated: Those names do not exist internally,

original: gnyis ka med par yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gnyis ka med par yang mi dmigs so //
translated: do not exist externally, and do not abide in between.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du gang 'di shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ming zhes bya ba'i chos de dag thams cad ni chos su gdags @123a *//🔽pa tsam du zad de /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du gang 'di shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ming zhes bya ba'i chos de dag thams cad ni chos su gdags @123a *// pa tsam du zad de /
translated: In the same way, Subhūti, all these dharmas—this so-called perfection of wisdom, this so-called bodhisattva, and this so-called name of a bodhisattva—are just designations of dharmas.

original: chos su btags pa de la ni ming dang brda tsam du tha snyad kyis gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba'am 'gag pa med de /
analyzed: chos su btags pa de la ni ming dang brda tsam du tha snyad kyis gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba'am 'gag pa med de /
translated: In that designation of dharmas, apart from a designation by way of a name and conventional term, there is no arising and no ceasing.

original: ming de ni nang na'ang med /
analyzed: ming de ni nang na'ang med /
translated: That name does not exist internally,

original: phyi rol na'ang med /
analyzed: phyi rol na'ang med /
translated: does not exist externally,

original: gnyis ka med par yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gnyis ka med par yang mi dmigs so //
translated: and is not apprehended as either of the two.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom like that,

original: ming dang brdar btags pa dang / gdams ngag tu btags pa dang / chos su btags pa la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: ming dang brdar btags pa dang / gdams ngag tu btags pa dang / chos su btags pa la bslab par bya'o //
translated: they should train in the designation by name and conventional term, the designation by instruction, and the designation by dharma.”

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa ni /🔽gzugs zhes bya ba rtag par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa ni / gzugs zhes bya ba rtag par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: The Bodhisattva, the great being, who courses in perfect wisdom does not review form as permanent or impermanent, as ease or ill, as self or not-self, as lovely or repulsive, as empty or not empty, as with or without a sign, as with or without a basis, as calm or not calm, as isolated or not isolated.🔽He does not review feeling, perception, the will to become, consciousness, as permanent or impermanent, as ease or ill, as self or not-self, as lovely or repulsive, as empty or not empty, as with or without a sign, as with or without a basis, as calm or not calm, as isolated or not isolated.

original: gzugs zhes bya ba mi rtag par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo; ;gzugs zhes bya ba bde bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //🔽gzugs zhes bya ba sdug bsngal bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //🔽gzugs zhes bya ba bdag tu yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //🔽gzugs zhes bya ba bdag med par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //🔽gzugs zhes bya ba zhi bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //🔽gzugs zhes bya ba ma zhi bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba mi rtag par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo; ;gzugs zhes bya ba bde bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo // gzugs zhes bya ba sdug bsngal bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo // gzugs zhes bya ba bdag tu yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo // gzugs zhes bya ba bdag med par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo // gzugs zhes bya ba zhi bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo // gzugs zhes bya ba ma zhi bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not review the perfection of giving as permanent or impermanent, as ease or ill, as self or not-self, as lovely or repulsive, as empty or not empty, as with or without a sign, as with or without a basis, as calm or not calm, as isolated or not isolated.🔽He does not review the perfection of morality, patience, vigour, concentration, wisdom, as permanent or impermanent, as ease or ill, as self or not-self, as lovely or repulsive, as empty or not empty, as with or without a sign, as with or without a basis, as calm or not calm, as isolated or not isolated.

original: gzugs zhes bya ba stong par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba stong par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not review the thirty-seven wings of enlightenment, the three doors to deliverance, the powers, the grounds of self-confidence, the analytical knowledges, the eighteen special dharmas of a Buddha, as permanent or impermanent, as ease or ill, as self or not-self, as lovely or repulsive, as empty or not empty, as with or without a sign, as with or without a basis, as calm or not calm, as isolated or not isolated.🔽He does not review the fruit of a Streamwinner, of a Once-Returner, of a Never-Returner, of Arhatship, of the enlightenment of a Pratyekabuddha, of the enlightenment of a Buddha, as permanent or impermanent, as ease or ill, as self or not-self, as lovely or repulsive, as empty or not empty, as with or without a sign, as with or without a basis, as calm or not calm, as isolated or not isolated.

original: gzugs zhes bya ba mi stong par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //🔽@123b gzugs zhes bya ba mtshan ma yod par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba mi stong par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo // @123b gzugs zhes bya ba mtshan ma yod par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not see form as not empty.🔽They do not see form as having signs.

original: gzugs zhes bya ba mtshan ma med par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //🔽gzugs zhes bya ba smon pa yod par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba mtshan ma med par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo // gzugs zhes bya ba smon pa yod par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not see form as signless.🔽They do not see form as having aspirations.

original: gzugs zhes bya ba smon pa med par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba smon pa med par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not see form as lacking aspirations.🔽They do not see form as compounded.

original: gzugs zhes bya ba 'dus byas su yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo; ;gzugs zhes bya ba 'dus ma byas su yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba 'dus byas su yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo; ;gzugs zhes bya ba 'dus ma byas su yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not see form as uncompounded.

original: gzugs zhes bya ba kun nas nyon mongs par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba kun nas nyon mongs par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not see form as afflicted.

original: gzugs zhes bya ba rnam par byang bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba rnam par byang bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not see form as purified.

original: gzugs zhes bya ba skye bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba skye bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not see the arising of what is called form.

original: gzugs zhes bya ba 'gag par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo; ;gzugs zhes bya ba dben par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba 'gag par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo; ;gzugs zhes bya ba dben par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not see the cessation of what is called form. They do not see what is called form as empty.

original: gzugs zhes bya ba mi dben par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //🔽gzugs zhes bya ba dge bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //🔽gzugs zhes bya ba mi dge bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba mi dben par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo // gzugs zhes bya ba dge bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo // gzugs zhes bya ba mi dge bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not see what is called form as not empty.🔽They do not see what is called form as afflicted.

original: gzugs zhes bya ba kha na ma tho ba dang bcas par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //🔽gzugs zhes bya ba kha na ma tho ba med par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba kha na ma tho ba dang bcas par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo // gzugs zhes bya ba kha na ma tho ba med par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not see what is called form as purified.🔽They do not see what is called form as with an essence.🔽They do not see what is called form as without an essence.

original: gzugs zhes bya ba zag pa dang bcas par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //🔽gzugs zhes bya ba zag pa @124a *//
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba zag pa dang bcas par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //🔽gzugs zhes bya ba zag pa @124a *//
translated: They do not see what is called form as with outflows.🔽They do not see what is called form as without outflows.

original: med par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //🔽gzugs zhes bya ba nyon mongs pa dang bcas par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: med par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo // gzugs zhes bya ba nyon mongs pa dang bcas par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not see it as nonexistent.🔽He does not see form as afflicted.

original: gzugs zhes bya ba nyon mongs pa med par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //🔽gzugs zhes bya ba 'jig rten par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba nyon mongs pa med par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo // gzugs zhes bya ba 'jig rten par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not see form as unafflicted.🔽He does not see form as worldly.

original: gzugs zhes bya ba 'jig rten las 'das par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba 'jig rten las 'das par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not see form as other than worldly.

original: gzugs zhes bya ba 'khor bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba 'khor bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not see form as saṃsāra.

original: gzugs zhes bya ba mya ngan las 'das par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba mya ngan las 'das par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not see form as nirvāṇa.

original: tshor ba zhes bya ba dang / 'du shes zhes bya ba dang / 'du byed ces bya ba dang / rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba rtag par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: tshor ba zhes bya ba dang / 'du shes zhes bya ba dang / 'du byed ces bya ba dang / rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba rtag par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not see feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness as permanent.

original: rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba mi rtag par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba mi rtag par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: they do not see consciousness as impermanent,

original: rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba bde bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba bde bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: they do not see consciousness as happiness,

original: rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba sdug bsngal bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //🔽rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba bdag tu yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba sdug bsngal bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo // rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba bdag tu yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: they do not see consciousness as suffering,🔽they do not see consciousness as a self,

original: rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba bdag med par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //🔽rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba zhi bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba bdag med par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo // rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba zhi bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: they do not see consciousness as not a self,🔽they do not see consciousness as peaceful,

original: rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ma zhi bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //🔽rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba stong par yang dag par rjes su mi @124b mthong ngo //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ma zhi bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo // rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba stong par yang dag par rjes su mi @124b mthong ngo //
translated: they do not see consciousness as not peaceful,🔽they do not see consciousness as empty,

original: rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba mi stong par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba mi stong par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: they do not see consciousness as not empty,

original: rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba mtshan ma yod par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba mtshan ma yod par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not see consciousness as having signs.

original: rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba mtshan ma med par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //🔽rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba smon pa yod par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba mtshan ma med par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo // rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba smon pa yod par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not see consciousness as signless.🔽They do not see consciousness as having aspirations.

original: rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba smon pa med par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //🔽rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba 'dus byas su yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba smon pa med par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo // rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba 'dus byas su yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not see consciousness as lacking aspirations.🔽They do not see consciousness as compounded.

translated: He does not see pleasure, pain, self, not self, peace, not peace, emptiness, not emptiness, signs, signlessness, wishes,

translated: wishlessness, the compounded, the uncompounded, defilement, purification, arising, cessation, seclusion, not seclusion, virtue,

analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi khams na yod par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: rnam par mi rtog ste /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog ste /
translated: they do not think about or conceptualize any of those dharmas.

original: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod de /

analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la bya ba @131b ma gtogs par /

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //

original: byang chub sems dpa' yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //

original: sangs rgyas kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //

translated: He does not see the name ‘buddha’ either.🔽He does not see the perfections, the emptinesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, the four truths of the noble ones, the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, the powers, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, or the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: He does not see the meditative stabilizations, the dhāraṇī gateways, the perfections, the emptinesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, the four immeasurables, the four formless absorptions, the eight deliverances, the nine serial absorptions, the emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness meditative stabilizations, or the meditative stabilizations of the bodhisattvas.

original: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang /🔽sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad bsgom pa'i phyir /🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod de /🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //

original: sangs rgyas kyi ming yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ming yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not see even the name of a buddha.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Because when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom

original: chos rnams kyi chos kyi mtshan nyid shin tu rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos kyi mtshan nyid shin tu rtogs pa yin te /
translated: they have realized the true nature of dharmas.

original: chos rnams kyi chos kyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos kyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The true nature of dharmas

original: kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: is not defiled

original: rnam par byang bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par byang bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and is not purified.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe; ming dang brdar bya ba'i chos su gdags pa khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe; ming dang brdar bya ba'i chos su gdags pa khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: “Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom in that way, they should understand the designation of a dharma as a name and conventional term.

original: de ltar des ming dang brdar bya ba'i chos su gdags pa khong du chud na /
analyzed: de ltar des ming dang brdar bya ba'i chos su gdags pa khong du chud na /
translated: When they understand the designation of a dharma as a name and conventional term,

original: gzugs la chags par 'gyur ba med do; ;tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: gzugs la chags par 'gyur ba med do; ;tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: nor to feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.

original: mig la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: mig la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: He does not become attached to the eyes,

original: gzugs la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: gzugs la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: nor to forms,

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: nor to eye consciousness,

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa la chags par 'gyur ba med do //🔽gang yang mig dang / gzugs dang / mig ga rnam @132b par shes pa 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba bde ba'am /🔽sdug bsngal ba'am /
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa la chags par 'gyur ba med do // gang yang mig dang / gzugs dang / mig ga rnam @132b par shes pa 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba bde ba'am / sdug bsngal ba'am /
translated: nor to the contact that occurs through the coming together of the three.

original: bde ba'ang ma yin sdug bsngal ba'ang ma yin pa skye ba de la'ang chags par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: bde ba'ang ma yin sdug bsngal ba'ang ma yin pa skye ba de la'ang chags par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: Whatever feeling that arises due to the condition of contact that occurs through the coming together of the eye, forms, and eye consciousness—whether it be pleasant, painful, or neither painful nor pleasant—he does not become attached to that.

original: rna ba la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: rna ba la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: He does not become attached to the ears,

original: sgra la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: sgra la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: nor to sounds,

original: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: nor to ear consciousness,🔽nor to the contact that occurs through the coming together of the three.

original: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: He does not get attached to ear-contact.

original: gang yang rna ba dang / sgra dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba bde ba'am /🔽sdug bsngal ba'am /
analyzed: gang yang rna ba dang / sgra dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba bde ba'am / sdug bsngal ba'am /
translated: Whatever feeling arises due to the condition of the convergence of the ear, sound, and ear-consciousness,🔽whether pleasant, painful, or neither-painful-nor-pleasant,

original: bde ba'ang ma yin sdug bsngal ba'ang ma yin pa skye ba de la'ang chags par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: bde ba'ang ma yin sdug bsngal ba'ang ma yin pa skye ba de la'ang chags par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: he does not get attached to that.

original: sna la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: sna la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: He does not get attached to the nose.

original: dri la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: dri la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: He does not get attached to smells.

original: sna'i rnam par shes pa la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: sna'i rnam par shes pa la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: He does not get attached to nose-consciousness.

original: sna'i 'dus te reg pa la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: sna'i 'dus te reg pa la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: He does not get attached to nose-contact.

original: gang yang sna dang / dri dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba bde ba'am /🔽sdug bsngal ba'am /
analyzed: gang yang sna dang / dri dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba bde ba'am / sdug bsngal ba'am /
translated: Whatever feeling arises due to the condition of the convergence of the nose, smells, and nose-consciousness,🔽whether pleasant, painful, or neither-painful-nor-pleasant,

original: bde ba'ang ma yin sdug bsngal ba'ang ma yin pa skye ba de la'ang chags par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: bde ba'ang ma yin sdug bsngal ba'ang ma yin pa skye ba de la'ang chags par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: he does not get attached to that.

original: lce la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: lce la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: He is not attached to the tongue.

original: ro la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: ro la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: He is not attached to tastes.

original: lce'i rnam par shes pa la chags par 'gyur ba med do; ;lce'i 'dus te reg pa la chags par 'gyur ba med do //🔽gang yang lce dang / ro dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba bde ba'am /🔽sdug bsngal ba'am /
analyzed: lce'i rnam par shes pa la chags par 'gyur ba med do; ;lce'i 'dus te reg pa la chags par 'gyur ba med do // gang yang lce dang / ro dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba bde ba'am / sdug bsngal ba'am /
translated: He is not attached to the tongue consciousness. He is not attached to the contact that arises from the coming together of the tongue, tastes, and the tongue consciousness.

original: @133a *// bde ba'ang ma yin sdug bsngal ba'ang ma yin pa skye ba de la'ang chags par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: @133a *// bde ba'ang ma yin sdug bsngal ba'ang ma yin pa skye ba de la'ang chags par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: He is not attached to the pleasant, unpleasant, or neither unpleasant nor pleasant feeling that arises from the contact that arises from the coming together of the tongue, tastes, and the tongue consciousness.

original: lus la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: lus la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: He is not attached to the body.

original: reg bya la chags par 'gyur ba med do //🔽lus kyi rnam par shes pa la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: reg bya la chags par 'gyur ba med do // lus kyi rnam par shes pa la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: He is not attached to tactile objects.

original: lus kyi 'dus te reg pa la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: lus kyi 'dus te reg pa la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: He is not attached to the body consciousness. He is not attached to the contact that arises from the coming together of the body, tactile objects, and the body consciousness.

original: gang yang lus dang / reg bya dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba bde ba'am /
analyzed: gang yang lus dang / reg bya dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba bde ba'am /
translated: He is not attached to the pleasant, unpleasant, or neither unpleasant nor pleasant feeling that arises from the contact that arises from the coming together of the body, tactile objects, and the body consciousness.

original: sdug bsngal ba'am /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba'am /
translated: or unpleasant,

original: bde ba'ang ma yin sdug bsngal ba'ang ma yin pa skye ba de la'ang chags par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: bde ba'ang ma yin sdug bsngal ba'ang ma yin pa skye ba de la'ang chags par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: or neither unpleasant nor pleasant, he does not become attached to it.

original: yid la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: yid la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: He does not become attached to the mind.

original: chos la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: chos la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: He does not become attached to dharmas.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: He does not become attached to the mind consciousness.

original: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: He does not become attached to the contact that is the coming together of the three.

original: gang yang yid dang / chos dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba bde ba'am /
analyzed: gang yang yid dang / chos dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba bde ba'am /
translated: Whatever feeling arises conditioned by the contact that is the coming together of the mind, dharmas, and mind consciousness—

original: sdug bsngal ba'am /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba'am /
translated: whether pleasant,

original: bde ba'ang ma yin sdug bsngal ba'ang ma yin pa skye ba de la'ang chags par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: bde ba'ang ma yin sdug bsngal ba'ang ma yin pa skye ba de la'ang chags par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: unpleasant, or neither unpleasant nor pleasant—he does not become attached to it.

original: 'dus byas kyi khams la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi khams la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: He does not become attached to the compounded element.

original: 'dus ma byas kyi khams la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi khams la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: He does not become attached to the uncompounded element.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: He does not become attached to the perfection of giving.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / @133b bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / @133b bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: He does not get attached to the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, or the perfection of wisdom.

original: de dag gi ming dang mtshan nyid la'ang chags par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: de dag gi ming dang mtshan nyid la'ang chags par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: He does not get attached to their names and defining marks.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i lus la'ang chags par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i lus la'ang chags par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: He does not get attached to the bodhisattva’s body.

original: sha'i mig la'ang chags par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: sha'i mig la'ang chags par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: He does not get attached to the fleshly eye.

original: lha'i mig dang / shes rab kyi mig dang / chos kyi mig dang / sangs rgyas kyi mig la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: lha'i mig dang / shes rab kyi mig dang / chos kyi mig dang / sangs rgyas kyi mig la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: He does not get attached to the divine eye, the wisdom eye, the Dharma eye, or the buddha eye.

original: mngon par shes pa rnams la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa rnams la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: He does not get attached to the clairvoyances.

original: nang stong pa nyid la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: He does not get attached to inner emptiness.

original: phyi stong pa nyid la chags par 'gyur ba med do; ;phyi nang stong pa nyid la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: phyi stong pa nyid la chags par 'gyur ba med do; ;phyi nang stong pa nyid la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: They do not get attached to external emptiness, nor to the emptiness of internal and external phenomena.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: They do not get attached to the emptiness of emptiness, nor to the great emptiness, nor to the ultimate emptiness, nor to the emptiness of conditioned phenomena, nor to the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, nor to the emptiness of what is beyond extremes, nor to the emptiness of the beginningless and endless, nor to the emptiness of non-discarded phenomena, nor to the emptiness of inherent existence, nor to the emptiness of all phenomena, nor to the emptiness of intrinsic defining characteristics, nor to the emptiness of non-apprehension, nor to the emptiness of non-entities, nor to the emptiness of essential nature, nor to the emptiness of non-entities’ essential nature.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: They do not get attached to the applications of mindfulness,

original: yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: nor to the correct exertions, nor to the supports for miraculous ability, nor to the faculties, nor to the powers, nor to the branches of enlightenment, nor to the noble eightfold path.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang /
translated: They do not get attached to the noble truths, nor to the meditative concentrations, nor to the immeasurable aspirations, nor to the formless meditative absorptions, nor to the eight deliverances, nor to the nine serial steps of meditative absorption, nor to emptiness,

original: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa @134a *//
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa @134a *//
translated: the absence of attributes,🔽the absence of aspiration,🔽and the superknowledges.🔽

original: rnams la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: rnams la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: He does not become attached to the emptiness of internal phenomena, the emptiness of external phenomena, the emptiness of both external and internal phenomena, the emptiness of emptiness, the emptiness of great extent, the emptiness of ultimate reality, the emptiness of conditioned phenomena, the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, the emptiness of the unlimited, the emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end, the emptiness of non-dispersal, the emptiness of inherent existence, the emptiness of all things, the emptiness of intrinsic identity, the emptiness of external phenomena, the emptiness of internal and external phenomena, the emptiness of emptiness, the emptiness of great extent, the emptiness of the ultimate, the emptiness of the conditioned, the emptiness of the unconditioned, the emptiness of what is beyond extremes, the emptiness of what is beginningless and endless, the emptiness of nature, the emptiness of all things, the emptiness of intrinsic defining characteristics, the emptiness of non-apprehension, the emptiness of non-entities, the emptiness of essential nature, and the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities.

original: ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: He does not become attached to the applications of mindfulness, the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the branches of enlightenment, or the noble eightfold path.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: He does not become attached to the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion, or the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas.

original: de bzhin nyid la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: He does not become attached to suchness.

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: He does not become attached to the very limit of reality.

original: chos kyi dbyings la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: He does not become attached to the dharma-constituent.

original: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: He does not become attached to bringing beings to maturity.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: He does not become attached to purifying a buddhafield.

original: thabs mkhas pa la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: thabs mkhas pa la chags par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: and he does not become attached to skillful means.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽de ni 'di ltar gang chags par byed pa'am /🔽gang gis chags par byed pa'am /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / de ni 'di ltar gang chags par byed pa'am / gang gis chags par byed pa'am /
translated: And why?🔽Because all those dharmas which would be attached,🔽or by which one would be attached,

original: gang la chags par bya ba de lta bu'i chos thams cad med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang la chags par bya ba de lta bu'i chos thams cad med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: or to which one would be attached, do not exist.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni /
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas rnam par 'phel lo; ;tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas rnam par 'phel lo; ;tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: like that grow the perfection of giving, the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration,

original: shes rab @134b kyi pha rol tu phyin pas rnam par 'phel lo //
analyzed: shes rab @134b kyi pha rol tu phyin pas rnam par 'phel lo //
translated: and the perfection of wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par yang dag par 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par yang dag par 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: They enter into the secure state of a bodhisattva,🔽and they grow the ten tathāgata powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i sa yongs su gnon par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i sa yongs su gnon par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will attain the irreversible level.

original: mngon par shes pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will perfect the superknowledges.

original: mngon par shes pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par byas nas kyang /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par byas nas kyang /
translated: Having perfected the superknowledges,

original: sems can yongs su smin par byed cing /
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par byed cing /
translated: they will bring beings to maturity.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la rim gror bya ba dang / bkur stir bya ba dang / bsti stang du bya ba dang / mchod pa byed cing /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la rim gror bya ba dang / bkur stir bya ba dang / bsti stang du bya ba dang / mchod pa byed cing /
translated: They will serve and venerate the blessed buddhas,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams blta ba'i phyir; sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams blta ba'i phyir; sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and they will go from buddhafield to buddhafield in order to purify a buddhafield and to behold the blessed buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag mthong nas kyang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag mthong nas kyang /
translated: Having beheld those blessed buddhas,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba gang gis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la rim gror bya ba dang / bkur stir bya ba dang / bsti stang du bya ba dang / mchod par bya bar 'dod pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang mngon par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba gang gis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la rim gror bya ba dang / bkur stir bya ba dang / bsti stang du bya ba dang / mchod par bya bar 'dod pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang mngon par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Whatever roots of virtue they wish to dedicate to the Blessed Buddhas, those roots of virtue will manifest.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag gis kyang; sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi drung du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag gis kyang; sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi drung du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And by those roots of virtue, they will be reborn in the presence of those Blessed Buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag las chos kyang thos par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag las chos kyang thos par 'gyur te /
translated: And they will hear the Dharma from those Blessed Buddhas.

original: ji skad du thos pa'i chos de dag kyang /
analyzed: ji skad du thos pa'i chos de dag kyang /
translated: And those Dharmas that they hear

original: nam bla  na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas kyi bar du rgyun mi chad par 'gyur ro //🔽gzungs kyi sgo rnams kyang thob bar 'gyur ro //🔽ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo rnams @135a *//
analyzed: nam bla  na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas kyi bar du rgyun mi chad par 'gyur ro // gzungs kyi sgo rnams kyang thob bar 'gyur ro // ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo rnams @135a *//
translated: will not be interrupted until they fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.🔽They will attain the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: kyang thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kyang thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will attain the samādhi gateways.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas /
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: ming dang brdar bya ba'i chos su gdags pa rnams de ltar khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: ming dang brdar bya ba'i chos su gdags pa rnams de ltar khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: should understand the designations of phenomena as names and conventional terms in that way.

original: rab 'byor / gang yang khyod kyis bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi na zhes smras pa de la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gang yang khyod kyis bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi na zhes smras pa de la /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'ang byang chub sems dpa' ma yin /
translated: Feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness are not a bodhisattva.

original: rnam par shes pa ma yin pa gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' ma yin /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ma yin pa gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' ma yin /
translated: That which is not consciousness is not a bodhisattva.

original: rnam par shes pa la'ang byang chub sems dpa' yod pa ma yin /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la'ang byang chub sems dpa' yod pa ma yin /
translated: Consciousness does not exist in a bodhisattva.

original: byang chub sems dpa' la'ang rnam par shes pa yod pa ma yin /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la'ang rnam par shes pa yod pa ma yin /
translated: A bodhisattva does not exist in consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa med pa'ang byang chub sems dpa' ma yin /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa med pa'ang byang chub sems dpa' ma yin /
translated: That which is not consciousness is not a bodhisattva.

original: lus kyi khams dang / reg bya'i khams dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / yid kyi khams dang / chos kyi khams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang; sa'i khams dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang /

translated: the body constituent, texture constituent, and body consciousness constituent; the thinking-mind constituent, mental-object constituent, and thinking-mind consciousness constituent; the earth element, water element, fire element,

analyzed: sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang / rga shi byang chub sems dpa' ma yin /

analyzed: rga shi ma yin pa gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' ma yin / rga shi la'ang byang chub sems dpa' yod pa ma yin /

original: byang chub sems dpa' la'ang rga shi yod pa ma yin /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la'ang rga shi yod pa ma yin /
translated: Aging and death do not exist in the bodhisattva.

original: rga shi med pa'ang byang chub sems dpa' ma yin /
analyzed: rga shi med pa'ang byang chub sems dpa' ma yin /
translated: That which is without aging and death is not the bodhisattva.

translated: the suchness of the element of sound, the suchness of the element of auditory consciousness, the suchness of the element of nose, the suchness of the element of smell, the suchness of the element of olfactory consciousness,

analyzed: lce'i khams kyi de bzhin nyid dang / @148a *//

analyzed: rga shi'i de bzhin nyid med pa'ang byang chub sems dpa' ma yin no zhes zer ////

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la gzugs mchis par yang ga la 'gyur /

analyzed: rnam par shes pa ma lags pa gzhan byang chub sems dpar 'gyur ba lta'ang ga la mchis /

analyzed: rnam par shes pa ma mchis pa byang chub sems dpar 'gyur ba lta'ang ga la mchis /

translated: the mind element, the phenomena element, and the mind consciousness element; the earth element, the water element, the fire element, the wind element, the space element, and the consciousness element; ignorance,

analyzed: lce'i de bzhin nyid dang / lus kyi de bzhin nyid dang / yid kyi de bzhin nyid dang / gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid dang / sgra'i de bzhin nyid dang / dri'i de bzhin nyid dang / ro'i de bzhin nyid dang / reg gi de bzhin nyid dang / chos kyi de bzhin nyid dang / mig gi khams kyi de bzhin nyid dang / gzugs kyi khams kyi de bzhin nyid dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi de bzhin nyid dang; rna ba'i khams kyi de bzhin nyid dang / sgra'i khams kyi de bzhin nyid dang /
translated: the suchness of the tongue, the suchness of the body, the suchness of the mind, the suchness of form, the suchness of sound, the suchness of smell, the suchness of taste, the suchness of texture,🔽the suchness of mental phenomena, the suchness of the eye constituent, the suchness of the form constituent, the suchness of the eye consciousness constituent, the suchness of the ear constituent, the suchness of the sound constituent,

original: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi de bzhin nyid dang / sna'i khams kyi de bzhin nyid dang / dri'i khams kyi @150a *//
analyzed: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi de bzhin nyid dang / sna'i khams kyi de bzhin nyid dang / dri'i khams kyi @150a *//
translated: the suchness of the ear consciousness constituent, the suchness of the nose constituent, the suchness of the smell constituent,

original: de bzhin nyid dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi de bzhin nyid dang / lce'i khams kyi de bzhin nyid dang / ro'i khams kyi de bzhin nyid dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi de bzhin nyid dang / lus kyi khams kyi de bzhin nyid dang /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi de bzhin nyid dang / lce'i khams kyi de bzhin nyid dang / ro'i khams kyi de bzhin nyid dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi de bzhin nyid dang / lus kyi khams kyi de bzhin nyid dang /
translated: the suchness of the element of the nose, the suchness of the element of smells, the suchness of the element of nose consciousness, the suchness of the element of the tongue, the suchness of the element of tastes, the suchness of the element of tongue consciousness, the suchness of the element of the body,

original: reg bya'i khams kyi de bzhin nyid dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi de bzhin nyid dang / yid kyi khams kyi de bzhin nyid dang / chos kyi khams kyi de bzhin nyid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi de bzhin nyid dang /
analyzed: reg bya'i khams kyi de bzhin nyid dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi de bzhin nyid dang / yid kyi khams kyi de bzhin nyid dang / chos kyi khams kyi de bzhin nyid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi de bzhin nyid dang /
translated: the suchness of the element of physical objects, the suchness of the element of body consciousness, the suchness of the element of the mental faculty, the suchness of the element of mental objects, and the suchness of the element of mental consciousness.

original: sa'i khams kyi de bzhin nyid dang / chu'i khams kyi de bzhin nyid dang / me'i khams kyi de bzhin nyid dang / rlung gi khams kyi de bzhin nyid dang / nam mkha'i khams kyi de bzhin nyid dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi de bzhin nyid dang /🔽ma rig pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / 'du byed kyi de bzhin nyid dang / rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / ming dang gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid dang / skye mched drug gi de bzhin nyid dang / reg pa'i de bzhin nyid dang /
analyzed: sa'i khams kyi de bzhin nyid dang / chu'i khams kyi de bzhin nyid dang / me'i khams kyi de bzhin nyid dang / rlung gi khams kyi de bzhin nyid dang / nam mkha'i khams kyi de bzhin nyid dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi de bzhin nyid dang / ma rig pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / 'du byed kyi de bzhin nyid dang / rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / ming dang gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid dang / skye mched drug gi de bzhin nyid dang / reg pa'i de bzhin nyid dang /
translated: How could the designation bodhisattva refer to the suchness of the earth element, the suchness of the water element, the suchness of the fire element, the suchness of the wind element, the suchness of the space element, and the suchness of the consciousness element?🔽How could the designation bodhisattva refer to the suchness of ignorance, the suchness of volitional factors, the suchness of consciousness, the suchness of name and form, the suchness of the six sense sources, the suchness of contact,

original: tshor ba'i de bzhin nyid dang / sred pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / len pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / srid pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / skye ba'i de bzhin nyid dang / rga shi'i de bzhin nyid kyi tshig bla dvags byang chub sems dpar 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /
analyzed: tshor ba'i de bzhin nyid dang / sred pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / len pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / srid pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / skye ba'i de bzhin nyid dang / rga shi'i de bzhin nyid kyi tshig bla dvags byang chub sems dpar 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /
translated: the suchness of sensation, the suchness of craving, the suchness of appropriation, the suchness of existence, the suchness of birth, and the suchness of old age and death?

original: rga shi'i de bzhin nyid ma lags pa gzhan byang chub sems dpar 'gyur ba lta'ang ga la mchis /
analyzed: rga shi'i de bzhin nyid ma lags pa gzhan byang chub sems dpar 'gyur ba lta'ang ga la mchis /
translated: How could anything other than the suchness of old age and death be a bodhisattva?

original: rga @150b shi'i de bzhin nyid la byang chub sems dpa' mchis par yang ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: rga @150b shi'i de bzhin nyid la byang chub sems dpa' mchis par yang ga la 'gyur /
translated: How could a bodhisattva exist in the suchness of old age and death?

original: byang chub sems dpa' la rga shi'i de bzhin nyid mchis par yang ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la rga shi'i de bzhin nyid mchis par yang ga la 'gyur /

original: rga shi'i de bzhin nyid ma mchis pa byang chub sems dpar 'gyur pa lta'ang ga la mchis te /
analyzed: rga shi'i de bzhin nyid ma mchis pa byang chub sems dpar 'gyur pa lta'ang ga la mchis te /
translated: How could something that is not the suchness of old age and death be a bodhisattva?

original: de ni gnas ma mchis so //
analyzed: de ni gnas ma mchis so //
translated: That is not possible.

original: byang chub sems dpa' tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa bde ba'i tshig bla dvags su 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa bde ba'i tshig bla dvags su 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /
translated: How could the bodhisattva be a designation for feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness as happiness?

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnam par shes pa sdug bsngal ba'i tshig bla dvags su 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnam par shes pa sdug bsngal ba'i tshig bla dvags su 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /

original: bdag shin tu ma mchis shing mi dmigs /
analyzed: bdag shin tu ma mchis shing mi dmigs /

original: bdag med pa shin tu ma mchis shing mi dmigs na /
analyzed: bdag med pa shin tu ma mchis shing mi dmigs na /

original: byang chub sems dpa' gzugs bdag yod pa'i tshig bla dvags su 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gzugs bdag yod pa'i tshig bla dvags su 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /

original: byang chub sems dpa' gzugs bdag med pa'i tshig bla dvags su 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gzugs bdag med pa'i tshig bla dvags su 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /
translated: How could the bodhisattva be a designation for form as a selflessness?

original: byang chub sems dpa' tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / @155a *//
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / @155a *//
translated: How could the bodhisattva be a designation for feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness as a self?

original: rnam par shes pa bdag yod pa'i tshig bla dvags su 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa bdag yod pa'i tshig bla dvags su 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnam par shes pa bdag med pa'i tshig bla dvags su 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnam par shes pa bdag med pa'i tshig bla dvags su 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: zhi ba shin tu ma mchis shing mi dmigs /
analyzed: zhi ba shin tu ma mchis shing mi dmigs /

analyzed: ma zhi ba shin tu ma mchis shing mi dmigs na /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gzugs ma zhi ba'i tshig bla dvags su 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnam par shes pa ma zhi ba'i tshig bla dvags su 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /

original: mi stong pa shin tu ma mchis shing mi dmigs na /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gzugs stong pa'i tshig bla dvags su 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gzugs mi stong pa'i tshig bla dvags su 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnam par shes pa mi stong pa'i tshig bla dvags su 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa smon pa yod pa'i tshig bla dvags su 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /

analyzed: legs so // rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de @156a *//

original: ltar spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: ltar spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom like that,🔽they do not apprehend a bodhisattva,

original: gzugs kyi tshig bla dvags mi dmigs pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i tshig bla dvags mi dmigs pa dang / gzugs rtag pa'i tshig bla dvags mi dmigs pa dang / gzugs mi rtag pa'i tshig bla dvags mi dmigs pa dang /

translated: the non-apprehension of the designation of form, the non-apprehension of the designation of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness, the non-apprehension of the designation of form as permanent, the non-apprehension of the designation of form as impermanent,

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa rtag pa'i tshig bla dvags mi dmigs pa dang / rnam par shes pa mi rtag pa'i tshig bla dvags mi dmigs pa dang / gzugs bde ba'i tshig bla dvags mi dmigs pa dang /

translated: the non-apprehension of the designation of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness as permanent, the non-apprehension of the designation of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness as impermanent, the non-apprehension of the designation of form as happiness,

translated: the non-apprehension of the designation ‘form is suffering’, the non-apprehension of the designation ‘feeling, perception, volitional factors and consciousness are happiness’, the non-apprehension of the designation ‘form is suffering’, the non-apprehension of the designation ‘feeling, perception, volitional factors and consciousness are suffering’,🔽the non-apprehension of the designation ‘form is a self’, the non-apprehension of the designation ‘form is not a self’, the non-apprehension of the designation ‘feeling, perception, volitional factors and consciousness are a self’,
