analyzed: rnam par shes pa bdag med pa'i tshig bla dvags mi dmigs pa dang / gzugs zhi ba'i tshig bla dvags mi dmigs pa dang / gzugs ma zhi ba'i tshig bla dvags mi dmigs pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang /
translated: the non-apprehension of the designation ‘feeling, perception, volitional factors and consciousness are not a self’, the non-apprehension of the designation ‘form is calm’, the non-apprehension of the designation ‘form is not calm’, the non-apprehension of the designation ‘feeling, perception, volitional factors and consciousness are calm’,

original: rnam par @156b shes pa zhi ba'i tshig bla dvags mi dmigs pa dang / rnam par shes pa ma zhi ba'i tshig bla dvags mi dmigs pa dang / gzugs stong pa'i tshig bla dvags mi dmigs pa dang / gzugs mi stong pa'i tshig bla dvags mi dmigs pa dang /
analyzed: rnam par @156b shes pa zhi ba'i tshig bla dvags mi dmigs pa dang / rnam par shes pa ma zhi ba'i tshig bla dvags mi dmigs pa dang / gzugs stong pa'i tshig bla dvags mi dmigs pa dang / gzugs mi stong pa'i tshig bla dvags mi dmigs pa dang /
translated: the non-apprehension of the term ‘consciousness is peaceful’, the non-apprehension of the term ‘consciousness is not peaceful’, the non-apprehension of the term ‘form is empty’, the non-apprehension of the term ‘form is not empty’,

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa stong pa'i tshig bla dvags mi dmigs pa dang / rnam par shes pa mi stong pa'i tshig bla dvags mi dmigs pa dang / gzugs mtshan ma yod pa'i tshig bla dvags mi dmigs pa dang /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa stong pa'i tshig bla dvags mi dmigs pa dang / rnam par shes pa mi stong pa'i tshig bla dvags mi dmigs pa dang / gzugs mtshan ma yod pa'i tshig bla dvags mi dmigs pa dang /
translated: the non-apprehension of the term ‘feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are empty’, the non-apprehension of the term ‘feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are not empty’, the non-apprehension of the term ‘form has a sign’,

original: gzugs mtshan ma med pa'i tshig bla dvags mi dmigs pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa mtshan ma yod pa'i tshig bla dvags mi dmigs pa dang / rnam par shes pa mtshan ma med pa'i tshig bla dvags mi dmigs pa dang /
analyzed: gzugs mtshan ma med pa'i tshig bla dvags mi dmigs pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa mtshan ma yod pa'i tshig bla dvags mi dmigs pa dang / rnam par shes pa mtshan ma med pa'i tshig bla dvags mi dmigs pa dang /
translated: the non-apprehension of the description of form as having signs, and the non-apprehension of the description of form as signless,🔽the non-apprehension of the description of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness as having signs, and the non-apprehension of the description of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness as signless,

original: gzugs smon pa yod pa'i tshig bla dvags mi dmigs pa dang / gzugs smon pa med pa'i tshig bla dvags mi dmigs pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa smon pa yod pa'i tshig bla dvags mi dmigs pa dang /
analyzed: gzugs smon pa yod pa'i tshig bla dvags mi dmigs pa dang / gzugs smon pa med pa'i tshig bla dvags mi dmigs pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa smon pa yod pa'i tshig bla dvags mi dmigs pa dang /
translated: the non-apprehension of the description of form as having aspirations, and the non-apprehension of the description of form as lacking aspirations, and the non-apprehension of the description of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness as having aspirations,

original: rnam par shes pa smon pa med pa'i tshig bla dvags mi dmigs par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa smon pa med pa'i tshig bla dvags mi dmigs par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
translated: and the non-apprehension of the description of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness as lacking aspirations.

original: rab 'byor / gang yang khyod 'di skad du bdag gis 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gang yang khyod 'di skad du bdag gis 'di lta ste /
translated: “Subhūti, you have also said, ‘I see no dharma called “perfection of wisdom.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i chos de lta bu yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i chos de lta bu yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes zer ba ni /
translated: “Bodhisattva” is not something that is seen.

original: rab 'byor / chos kyis chos kyi dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //🔽chos kyi dbyings kyis chos yang dag par @157a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / chos kyis chos kyi dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo // chos kyi dbyings kyis chos yang dag par @157a *//
translated: Subhūti, the dharma does not see the dharma-constituent.

original: rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: The dharma-constituent does not see the dharma.

original: rab 'byor / gzugs kyi dbyings kyis chos kyi dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzugs kyi dbyings kyis chos kyi dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: Subhūti, the form-constituent does not see the dharma-constituent.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyis gzugs kyi dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //🔽tshor ba'i dbyings kyis chos kyi dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //🔽chos kyi dbyings kyis tshor ba'i dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyis gzugs kyi dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo // tshor ba'i dbyings kyis chos kyi dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo // chos kyi dbyings kyis tshor ba'i dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: The dharma-constituent does not see the form-constituent.🔽The feeling-constituent does not see the dharma-constituent.🔽The dharma-constituent does not see the feeling-constituent.

original: 'du shes kyi dbyings kyis chos kyi dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'du shes kyi dbyings kyis chos kyi dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: The perception-constituent does not see the dharma-constituent.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyis 'du shes kyi dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyis 'du shes kyi dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: The realm of phenomena does not see the realm of perception.

original: 'du byed kyi dbyings kyis chos kyi dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi dbyings kyis chos kyi dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: The realm of mental formations does not see the realm of phenomena.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyis 'du byed kyi dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //🔽rnam par shes pa'i dbyings kyis chos kyi dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyis 'du byed kyi dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo // rnam par shes pa'i dbyings kyis chos kyi dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: The realm of phenomena does not see the realm of mental formations.🔽The realm of consciousness does not see the realm of phenomena.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyis rnam par shes pa'i dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //🔽mig gi dbyings kyis chos kyi dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyis rnam par shes pa'i dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo // mig gi dbyings kyis chos kyi dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: The realm of phenomena does not see the realm of consciousness.🔽The realm of the eyes does not see the realm of phenomena.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyis mig gi dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyis mig gi dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: The realm of phenomena does not see the realm of the eyes.

original: rna ba'i dbyings dang / sna'i dbyings dang / lce'i dbyings dang / lus kyi dbyings dang / yid kyi dbyings kyis chos kyi dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: rna ba'i dbyings dang / sna'i dbyings dang / lce'i dbyings dang / lus kyi dbyings dang / yid kyi dbyings kyis chos kyi dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: the ear element, the nose element, the tongue element, the body element, and the thinking-mind element do not see the dharma element.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyis yid kyi dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyis yid kyi dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: The dharma element does not see the thinking-mind element.

original: rab 'byor / 'dus byas kyi dbyings kyis 'dus ma byas kyi @157b dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'dus byas kyi dbyings kyis 'dus ma byas kyi @157b dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: Subhūti, the compounded element does not see the uncompounded element.

original: 'dus ma byas kyi dbyings kyis 'dus byas kyi dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi dbyings kyis 'dus byas kyi dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: The uncompounded element does not see the compounded element.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽'dus byas kyi dbyings ma yin par yang 'dus ma byas kyi dbyings gdags par mi nus so //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / 'dus byas kyi dbyings ma yin par yang 'dus ma byas kyi dbyings gdags par mi nus so //
translated: Why is that?🔽The uncompounded element cannot be designated apart from the compounded element.

original: 'dus ma byas kyi dbyings ma yin par yang 'dus byas kyi dbyings gdags par mi nus te /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi dbyings ma yin par yang 'dus byas kyi dbyings gdags par mi nus te /
translated: The compounded element cannot be designated apart from the uncompounded element.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /🔽chos gang yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe / chos gang yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: Subhūti, in this way, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,🔽they do not see any dharma at all.

original: yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bas /
analyzed: yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bas /
translated: Since they do not see any dharma,

original: mi 'jigs mi dngangs skrag par mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: mi 'jigs mi dngangs skrag par mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: they are not afraid, terrified, or frightened.

original: de'i sems chos gang la'ang zhum par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i sems chos gang la'ang zhum par mi 'gyur /
translated: Their minds do not become timid with regard to any dharma.

original: yid 'gyod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yid 'gyod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They do not have any regrets.

original: rab 'byor / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Subhūti, why is that?

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: It is because when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: gzugs yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzugs yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: they do not see form.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo; ;mig yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo; ;mig yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not see feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness. They do not see the eyes.

original: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not see the ear, nose, tongue, body, or mind.

original: gzugs yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzugs yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not see form.

original: sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg dang / chos yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg dang / chos yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not see sound, smell, taste, texture, or mental phenomena.

original: sa'i khams yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //🔽chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams @158a *//
analyzed: sa'i khams yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo // chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams @158a *//
translated: He does not see the earth element.

original: dang; rnam par shes pa'i khams yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: dang; rnam par shes pa'i khams yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not see the water element, the fire element, the wind element, the space element, or the consciousness element.

original: ma rig pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: ma rig pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not see ignorance.

original: 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang / rga shi yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang / rga shi yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not see volitional actions, consciousness, name and form, the six sense sources, contact, sensation, craving, grasping, becoming, birth, or old age and death.

original: 'dod chags yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'dod chags yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not consider desire.

original: zhe sdang dang / gti mug yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: zhe sdang dang / gti mug yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not consider hatred. He does not consider confusion.

original: bdag yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //🔽sems can dang / srog dang / gso ba dang / skyes bu dang / gang zag dang / shed can dang / shed bdag dang / byed pa po dang / byed du 'jug pa po dang / tshor ba po dang / tshor bar byed pa po dang /
analyzed: bdag yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo // sems can dang / srog dang / gso ba dang / skyes bu dang / gang zag dang / shed can dang / shed bdag dang / byed pa po dang / byed du 'jug pa po dang / tshor ba po dang / tshor bar byed pa po dang /
translated: He does not consider a self.

original: shes pa po dang / mthong ba po yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: shes pa po dang / mthong ba po yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not consider a being, a living being, a creature, one born of Brahma, an individual soul, a man, one who does, one who feels, one who grows, one who knows, one who sees.

original: 'dod pa'i khams yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not consider the desire realm.

original: gzugs kyi khams yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not consider the form realm.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo; ;nyan thos kyi sems yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo; ;nyan thos kyi sems yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not consider the formless realm. He does not consider the thought of the śrāvakas.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sems yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sems yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not consider the thought of the pratyekabuddhas.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sems yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo; ;nyan thos yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sems yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo; ;nyan thos yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: he does not see the śrāvaka,

original: nyan thos kyi chos yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi chos yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: he does not see the śrāvaka’s Dharma,

original: rang sangs rgyas yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: he does not see the pratyekabuddha,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi chos @158b yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi chos @158b yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: he does not see the pratyekabuddha’s Dharma,

original: byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: he does not see the bodhisattva,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i chos yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i chos yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: he does not see the bodhisattva’s Dharma,

original: sangs rgyas yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: he does not see the Buddha,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: he does not see the Buddha’s Dharma,

original: byang chub yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: he does not see awakening,

original: byang chub kyi chos yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi chos yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: he does not see the Dharma of awakening.

original: 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad kyi bar du yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad kyi bar du yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: and up to all mundane and supramundane dharmas.

original: de chos thams cad yang dag par rjes su mi mthong bas /🔽mi 'jigs mi dngangs skrag par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de chos thams cad yang dag par rjes su mi mthong bas / mi 'jigs mi dngangs skrag par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And he, not perceiving any dharma,

original: gsol pa; bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa; bcom ldan 'das /
translated: does not tremble, is not frightened, and is not terrified.

original: ci'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /🔽chos thams cad la sems zhum par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: ci'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe / chos thams cad la sems zhum par mi 'gyur /
translated: Śāriputra: “Lord, why, when bodhisattva great beings are practicing the perfection of wisdom,🔽do they not tremble,

original: yongs su zhum par mi 'gyur ba lags /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: yongs su zhum par mi 'gyur ba lags / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: do not feel frightened, and are not terrified at all dharmas?”

original: rab 'byor / de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos /
translated: The Lord: “Subhūti, it is because bodhisattva great beings

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: do not see mind and mental factor dharmas.

original: rab 'byor / de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Subhūti, for that reason, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: chos thams cad la sems zhum pa med cing yongs su zhum pa med do //
analyzed: chos thams cad la sems zhum pa med cing yongs su zhum pa med do //
translated: they do not have a discouraged or timid mind with regard to all dharmas.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti said, “Blessed One,

original: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yid yongs su skrag par mi 'gyur ba lags /
analyzed: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yid yongs su skrag par mi 'gyur ba lags /
translated: how do bodhisattva great beings not have a timid mind?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: @159a *// rab 'byor /
analyzed: @159a *// rab 'byor /
translated: “Subhūti,

original: de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos yid dang / yid kyi khams yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos yid dang / yid kyi khams yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: it is because bodhisattva great beings do not see the mind and the mind constituent.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i yid yongs su skrag par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i yid yongs su skrag par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Subhūti, in that way bodhisattva great beings do not have a timid mind.”

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de ltar chos thams cad mi dmigs pas; shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de ltar chos thams cad mi dmigs pas; shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya ste /
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings should train in the perfection of wisdom by not apprehending any phenomena at all.

original: rab 'byor / gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Subhūti, if, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de'ang mi dmigs /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de'ang mi dmigs /
translated: they do not apprehend that perfection of wisdom,

original: byang chub sems dpa' de'ang mi dmigs /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de'ang mi dmigs /
translated: they do not apprehend that bodhisattva,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i ming de'ang mi dmigs /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i ming de'ang mi dmigs /
translated: they do not apprehend that name ‘bodhisattva,’

original: byang chub kyi sems de'ang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems de'ang mi dmigs na /
translated: and they do not apprehend that thought of awakening,

original: de nyid byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i gdams ngag yin te /
analyzed: de nyid byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i gdams ngag yin te /
translated: that is the instruction for bodhisattva great beings.

original: de nyid rjes su bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid rjes su bstan pa yin no //
translated: That is the teaching.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las /
translated: In the Perfection of Wisdom in Twenty-five Thousand Lines,

original: le'u gsum pa'o;; ;;de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
analyzed: le'u gsum pa'o;; ;;de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
translated: this was the third chapter: “The Instruction.”

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then venerable Subhūti said to the Lord:🔽“Lord, how should bodhisattva great beings train in the perfection of wisdom?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: gzugs yongs su rtogs par 'tshal ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
analyzed: gzugs yongs su rtogs par 'tshal ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
translated: bodhisattva great beings who want to fully understand form should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam @159b par shes pa yongs su rtogs par 'tshal ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //

translated: bodhisattva great beings who want to fully understand feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

analyzed: mig yongs su rtogs par 'tshal ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //

analyzed: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid yongs su rtogs par 'tshal ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
translated: bodhisattva great beings who want to fully understand the ears, nose, tongue, body, and thinking mind should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: gzugs yongs su rtogs par 'tshal ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
analyzed: gzugs yongs su rtogs par 'tshal ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
translated: “Blessed One, bodhisattva great beings who want to fully understand form should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg dang / chos yongs su rtogs par 'tshal ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
analyzed: sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg dang / chos yongs su rtogs par 'tshal ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
translated: Bodhisattva great beings who want to fully understand sound, smell, taste, texture, and mental phenomena should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: bcom ldan 'das /

translated: Blessed One,

translated: bodhisattva great beings who want to fully understand eye consciousness should train in the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa yongs su rtogs par 'tshal ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o // bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord, bodhisattva great beings who want to fully understand the eye sense field should train in the perfection of wisdom.🔽“Lord, bodhisattva great beings who want to fully understand the form sense field and eye sense field should train in the perfection of wisdom.🔽“Lord, bodhisattva great beings who want to fully understand the ear, nose, tongue, body, and thinking-mind sense fields and the sound, smell, taste, tangible object, and dharma sense fields should train in the perfection of wisdom.🔽“Lord, bodhisattva great beings who want to fully understand the eye base should train in the perfection of wisdom.🔽“Lord, bodhisattva great beings who want to fully understand the form base and eye base should train in the perfection of wisdom.🔽“Lord, bodhisattva great beings who want to fully understand the ear, nose, tongue, body, and thinking-mind bases and the sound, smell, taste, tangible object, and dharma bases should train in the perfection of wisdom.🔽“Lord, bodhisattva great beings who want to fully understand the earth element should train in the perfection of wisdom.🔽“Lord, bodhisattva great beings who want to fully understand the water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness elements should train in the perfection of wisdom.🔽“Lord, bodhisattva great beings who want to fully understand the eye-source should train in the perfection of wisdom.🔽“Lord, bodhisattva great beings who want to fully understand the form-source and eye-source should train in the perfection of wisdom.

translated: “Lord, bodhisattva great beings who want to fully understand the ear, nose, tongue, body, and thinking-mind sources and the sound, smell, taste, tangible object, and dharma sources should train in the perfection of wisdom.🔽“Lord, bodhisattva great beings who want

analyzed: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba yongs su rtogs par 'tshal ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
translated: Lord, bodhisattva great beings who want to fully understand the causal condition of the knowledge of all aspects should train in the perfection of wisdom.”🔽The Lord said, “So it is, Subhūti.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: It is so, Subhūti.🔽Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings who want to fully understand the causal condition of the constituents should train in the perfection of wisdom.🔽Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings who want to fully understand the causal condition of the sense fields should train in the perfection of wisdom.🔽Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings who want to fully understand the causal condition of the perfection of giving should train in the perfection of wisdom.

translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings who want to fully understand the causal

original: 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg @160b pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang / rga ba dang /
analyzed: 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg @160b pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang / rga ba dang /
translated: and consciousness, name and form, the six sense sources, contact, feeling, craving, grasping, becoming, birth, aging,🔽sickness, death, sorrow, lamentation, suffering, unhappiness, and disturbance.🔽“Blessed One,

original: na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa yongs su rtogs par 'tshal ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
analyzed: na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa yongs su rtogs par 'tshal ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
translated: bodhisattva great beings who wish to abandon desire, anger, and ignorance should train in the perfection of wisdom.”

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang; gti mug spang bar 'tshal ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang; gti mug spang bar 'tshal ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
translated: “Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings who wish to abandon desire, anger, and ignorance should train in the perfection of wisdom.”

original: 'jig tshogs su lta ba spang bar 'tshal ba dang / the tshom dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs snyems pa spang bar 'tshal ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //🔽'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang / gnod sems spang bar 'tshal ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs su lta ba spang bar 'tshal ba dang / the tshom dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs snyems pa spang bar 'tshal ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o // 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang / gnod sems spang bar 'tshal ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
translated: “Bodhisattva great beings who want to give up the view of the transitory collection, doubt, and the conceit of morality and ritual should train in the perfection of wisdom.🔽Bodhisattva great beings who want to give up attachment to sense objects and malice should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang; gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags spang bar 'tshal ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang; gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags spang bar 'tshal ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
translated: Bodhisattva great beings who want to give up attachment to the form realm and attachment to the formless realm should train in the perfection of wisdom.”

original: kun tu sbyor ba dang / bag la nyal ba dang / kun nas ldang ba spang bar 'tshal ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //🔽zas bzhi yongs su rtogs par 'tshal @161a *//
analyzed: kun tu sbyor ba dang / bag la nyal ba dang / kun nas ldang ba spang bar 'tshal ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o // zas bzhi yongs su rtogs par 'tshal @161a *//
translated: “The bodhisattva great beings who wish to abandon the fetters, latent tendencies, and entanglements should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
analyzed: ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
translated: “The bodhisattva great beings who wish to understand the four foods should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: sbyor ba bzhi dang / chu bo bzhi dang / mdud pa bzhi dang / nye bar len pa bzhi dang / phyin ci log bzhi spang bar 'tshal ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba bzhi dang / chu bo bzhi dang / mdud pa bzhi dang / nye bar len pa bzhi dang / phyin ci log bzhi spang bar 'tshal ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
translated: “The bodhisattva great beings who wish to abandon the four attachments, the four rivers, the four knots, the four clingings, and the four errors should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam spang bar 'tshal ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam spang bar 'tshal ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
translated: “The bodhisattva great beings who wish to abandon the ten unwholesome courses of action should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yongs su rdzogs par bgyi bar 'tshal ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //🔽bsam gtan bzhi yongs su rdzogs par bgyi bar 'tshal ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //🔽tshad med pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par bgyi bar 'tshal ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
analyzed: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yongs su rdzogs par bgyi bar 'tshal ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o // bsam gtan bzhi yongs su rdzogs par bgyi bar 'tshal ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o // tshad med pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par bgyi bar 'tshal ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
translated: “A bodhisattva great being who wants to complete the path of the ten virtuous actions should train in the perfection of wisdom.🔽“A bodhisattva great being who wants to complete the four concentrations should train in the perfection of wisdom.🔽“A bodhisattva great being who wants to complete the four immeasurables should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par bgyi bar 'tshal ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par bgyi bar 'tshal ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
translated: “A bodhisattva great being who wants to complete the four formless absorptions should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: mngon par shes pa lnga yongs su rdzogs par bgyi bar 'tshal ba'i byang chub sems @161b dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //🔽sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bgyi bar 'tshal ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa lnga yongs su rdzogs par bgyi bar 'tshal ba'i byang chub sems @161b dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o // sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bgyi bar 'tshal ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
translated: “A bodhisattva great being who wishes to perfect the five higher knowledges should train in the perfection of wisdom.🔽“A bodhisattva great being who wishes to perfect the perfection of giving should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bgyi bar 'tshal ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bgyi bar 'tshal ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
translated: “A bodhisattva great being who wishes to perfect the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom should train in the perfection of wisdom.”

original: nang stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par bgyi bar 'tshal ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //🔽phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du yongs su rdzogs par bgyi bar 'tshal ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par bgyi bar 'tshal ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o // phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du yongs su rdzogs par bgyi bar 'tshal ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
translated: “A bodhisattva great being who wants to complete the emptiness of internal phenomena should train in the perfection of wisdom.🔽A bodhisattva great being who wants to complete the emptiness of external phenomena, the emptiness of both external and internal phenomena, and the emptiness of emptiness, up to the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par bgyi bar 'tshal ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par bgyi bar 'tshal ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
translated: A bodhisattva great being who wants to complete the four applications of mindfulness should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa yongs @162a *//🔽su rdzogs par bgyi bar 'tshal ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa yongs @162a *// su rdzogs par bgyi bar 'tshal ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
translated: “The bodhisattva mahāsattvas who wish to complete the four right efforts, the four legs of miraculous power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven aspects of enlightenment, and the noble eightfold path should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa yongs su rdzogs par bgyi bar 'tshal ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa yongs su rdzogs par bgyi bar 'tshal ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
translated: “The bodhisattva mahāsattvas who wish to complete emptiness, signlessness, and aspirationlessness should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug par dgu yongs su rdzogs par bgyi bar 'tshal ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug par dgu yongs su rdzogs par bgyi bar 'tshal ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
translated: “The bodhisattva mahāsattvas who wish to perfect the four noble truths, the eight liberations, and the nine serial absorptions should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu yongs su rdzogs par bgyi bar 'tshal ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu yongs su rdzogs par bgyi bar 'tshal ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
translated: “The bodhisattva mahāsattvas who wish to perfect the ten powers of the tathāgatas should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yongs su rdzogs par bgyi bar 'tshal ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yongs su rdzogs par bgyi bar 'tshal ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva who wishes to perfect the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas te /
translated: “He should abide in the meditative stabilization endowed with the branches of enlightenment.

original: bsam gtan dang po las langs nas 'gog pa la mnyam par bzhag pa dang / de las langs nas /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po las langs nas 'gog pa la mnyam par bzhag pa dang / de las langs nas /
translated: Rising from the first concentration, he should rest in equipoise in cessation. Rising from that,

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa la mnyam @162b par bzhag pa dang / de las langs nas 'gog pa la mnyam par bzhag pa dang / de las langs nas bsam gtan gsum pa la mnyam par bzhag pa dang / de las langs nas 'gog pa la mnyam par bzhag pa dang /
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa la mnyam @162b par bzhag pa dang / de las langs nas 'gog pa la mnyam par bzhag pa dang / de las langs nas bsam gtan gsum pa la mnyam par bzhag pa dang / de las langs nas 'gog pa la mnyam par bzhag pa dang /
translated: he should rest in equipoise in the second concentration. Rising from that, he should rest in equipoise in cessation. Rising from that, he should rest in equipoise in the third concentration. Rising from that, he should rest in equipoise in cessation.

original: de las langs nas bsam gtan bzhi pa la mnyam par bzhag pa dang / de las langs nas 'gog pa la mnyam par bzhag pa dang / de las langs nas byams pa'i ting nge 'dzin la mnyam par bzhag pa dang / de las langs nas 'gog pa la mnyam par bzhag pa dang /
analyzed: de las langs nas bsam gtan bzhi pa la mnyam par bzhag pa dang / de las langs nas 'gog pa la mnyam par bzhag pa dang / de las langs nas byams pa'i ting nge 'dzin la mnyam par bzhag pa dang / de las langs nas 'gog pa la mnyam par bzhag pa dang /
translated: having risen from that, he entered meditative equipoise in the concentration of love;🔽having risen from that, he entered meditative equipoise in cessation;🔽having risen from that, he entered meditative equipoise in the concentration of compassion;🔽having risen from that, he entered meditative equipoise in cessation;🔽having risen from that, he entered meditative equipoise in the concentration of joy;

original: de las langs nas snying rje'i ting nge 'dzin la mnyam par bzhag pa dang / de las langs nas 'gog pa la mnyam par bzhag pa dang / de las langs nas dga' ba'i ting nge 'dzin la mnyam par bzhag pa dang / de las langs nas 'gog pa la mnyam par bzhag pa dang /
analyzed: de las langs nas snying rje'i ting nge 'dzin la mnyam par bzhag pa dang / de las langs nas 'gog pa la mnyam par bzhag pa dang / de las langs nas dga' ba'i ting nge 'dzin la mnyam par bzhag pa dang / de las langs nas 'gog pa la mnyam par bzhag pa dang /
translated: having risen from that, he entered meditative equipoise in cessation;

original: de las langs nas btang snyoms kyi ting nge 'dzin la mnyam par bzhag pa dang / de las langs nas 'gog pa la mnyam par bzhag pa dang / de las langs nas nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la mnyam par bzhag pa dang / de las langs nas 'gog pa la mnyam par bzhag pa dang /
analyzed: de las langs nas btang snyoms kyi ting nge 'dzin la mnyam par bzhag pa dang / de las langs nas 'gog pa la mnyam par bzhag pa dang / de las langs nas nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la mnyam par bzhag pa dang / de las langs nas 'gog pa la mnyam par bzhag pa dang /
translated: Then, having risen from that, he enters meditative equipoise in cessation.🔽Then, having risen from that, he enters meditative equipoise in the base of nothingness.🔽Then, having risen from that, he enters meditative equipoise in cessation.🔽Then, having risen from that, he enters meditative equipoise in the base of infinite consciousness.

original: de las langs nas cung zad med pa'i skye mched la mnyam par bzhag pa dang / de las langs nas 'gog pa la mnyam par bzhag pa dang / de las langs nas rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched la mnyam par bzhag pa dang / de las langs nas 'gog pa la mnyam par bzhag pa @163a *//

translated: Then, having risen from that, he enters meditative equipoise in cessation.

translated: and having risen from that, to enter into the concentration of cessation.🔽The bodhisattva great beings who want to enter into the concentration of the lion’s play🔽and the bodhisattva great beings who want to enter into the concentration of the lion’s sport

analyzed: sengge rnam par rtse ba'i ting nge 'dzin la mnyam par bzhag par 'tshal ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
translated: should train in the perfection of wisdom.”

original: gzungs kyi sgo dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo thams cad thob par 'tshal ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brlab par bgyi'o //

translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva who wishes to attain all the dhāraṇī gateways and all the samādhi gateways should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin la mnyam par bzhag par 'tshal ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
analyzed: dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin la mnyam par bzhag par 'tshal ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva who wishes to attain the samādhi of the heroic stride should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: rin chen phyag rgya'i ting nge 'dzin dang / zla ba'i 'od kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / zla ba'i rgyal mtshan dpal gyi ting nge 'dzin dang / chos thams cad kyi phyag rgyar gyur ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang / spyan ras gzigs kyi phyag rgya'i ting nge 'dzin dang /
analyzed: rin chen phyag rgya'i ting nge 'dzin dang / zla ba'i 'od kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / zla ba'i rgyal mtshan dpal gyi ting nge 'dzin dang / chos thams cad kyi phyag rgyar gyur ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang / spyan ras gzigs kyi phyag rgya'i ting nge 'dzin dang /
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva who wishes to attain the samādhi of the seal of jewels, the samādhi of the light of the moon, the samādhi of the glory of the moon’s victory banner, the samādhi that is the seal of all phenomena, the samādhi of the seal of Avalokiteśvara,

translated: the samādhi of certainty in the realm of all phenomena, the samādhi of the glorious banner of certainty, the vajra-like samādhi, the samādhi of the gateway to engaging with all phenomena, the samādhi of the king of samādhis,🔽the samādhi of the king’s seal, the samādhi of the arrayed army, the samādhi of perfect nobility, the samādhi of the definitive words of all phenomena, the samādhi of engaging with the knowledge of all phenomena,

original: rgyal po'i phyag rgya'i ting nge 'dzin dang / dpung rnam par bkod pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / yang dag par 'phags pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / chos thams cad kyi nges pa'i tshig gdon mi za bar 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / chos thams cad shes par gnas pa la 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang /

translated: and the samādhi of the knowledge of all phenomena.

original: phyogs bcur rnam par lta ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad kyi phyag rgya'i ting nge 'dzin dang / chos thams cad mnyam pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / chos thams cad yang dag par 'du ba'i rang bzhin phyag rgya'i ting nge 'dzin dang /
analyzed: phyogs bcur rnam par lta ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad kyi phyag rgya'i ting nge 'dzin dang / chos thams cad mnyam pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / chos thams cad yang dag par 'du ba'i rang bzhin phyag rgya'i ting nge 'dzin dang /
translated: the samadhi of looking in the ten directions, the samadhi of the seal of all dharanis, the samadhi of the equality of all dharmas, the samadhi of the seal of the nature of the gathering of all dharmas,

original: nam mkha'i gnas la gnas pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / mngon par shes pa mi nyams pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / snod du gyur pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / rgyal mtshan rtse mo'i dpung rgyan gyi ting nge 'dzin dang /
analyzed: nam mkha'i gnas la gnas pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / mngon par shes pa mi nyams pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / snod du gyur pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / rgyal mtshan rtse mo'i dpung rgyan gyi ting nge 'dzin dang /
translated: the samadhi of abiding in the abode of space, the samadhi of the complete purity of the three spheres, the samadhi of not losing the superknowledges, the samadhi of becoming a vessel, the samadhi of the victory banner’s ornament,

translated: the samādhi that burns all afflictions without exception, the samādhi that dispels the armies of the four māras, the samādhi of the lamp of wisdom, the samādhi of the superiority of the power of the ten powers, and the samādhi of the unattached liberation that is like space.🔽“Blessed One, bodhisattva great beings who wish to attain these and other samādhi gateways should train in the perfection of wisdom.”

original: de ltar de dag dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo gzhan dag thob par 'tshal ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //

translated: “Blessed One, bodhisattva great beings who wish to attain these and other samādhi gateways should train in the perfection of wisdom.”

translated: would be a fault.

original: gzugs 'di spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs 'di spang bar bya'o //
translated: This form should be abandoned.

original: 'dis gzugs spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis gzugs spang bar bya'o //
translated: By this, form should be abandoned.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / @165b 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa 'di spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / @165b 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa 'di spang bar bya'o //
translated: This feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness should be abandoned.

original: 'dis rnam par shes pa spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis rnam par shes pa spang bar bya'o //
translated: By this, consciousness should be abandoned.

original: sdug bsngal 'di yongs su shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'di yongs su shes par bya'o //
translated: This suffering should be fully understood.

original: 'dis sdug bsngal yongs su shes par bya'o //🔽kun 'byung ba 'di spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis sdug bsngal yongs su shes par bya'o // kun 'byung ba 'di spang bar bya'o //
translated: By this, suffering should be fully understood.🔽This origination should be abandoned.

original: 'dis kun 'byung ba spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis kun 'byung ba spang bar bya'o //
translated: By this, origination should be abandoned.

original: 'gog pa 'di mngon du bya'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa 'di mngon du bya'o //
translated: This cessation should be manifested.

original: 'dis 'gog pa mngon du bya'o //🔽lam 'di bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis 'gog pa mngon du bya'o // lam 'di bsgom par bya'o //
translated: By this, cessation should be manifested.🔽This path should be cultivated.

original: 'dis lam bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis lam bsgom par bya'o //
translated: By this, the path should be cultivated.

original: 'di ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: This is defilement.

original: 'di ni rnam par byang ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par byang ba'o //
translated: This is purification.

original: chos 'di dag ni bsten par bya ba'o //
analyzed: chos 'di dag ni bsten par bya ba'o //
translated: These dharmas should be relied upon.

original: chos 'di dag ni bsten par mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: chos 'di dag ni bsten par mi bya ba'o //
translated: These dharmas should not be relied upon.

original: 'di la ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos spyad par bya'o //
translated: In this, the bodhisattva mahāsattva should practice.

original: 'di la ni spyad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la ni spyad par mi bya'o //
translated: This is not to be practiced.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i lam mo //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i lam mo //
translated: This is the bodhisattva path.

original: 'di ni lam ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni lam ma yin no //
translated: This is not the path.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa'o //
translated: This is the bodhisattva training.

original: 'di ni bslab pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni bslab pa ma yin no //
translated: This is not the training.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: This is the bodhisattva perfection of generosity.

original: 'di ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin no //
translated: This is not the perfection of generosity.

original: 'di ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: This is the perfection of moral discipline.

original: 'di ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin no //
translated: This is not the perfection of moral discipline.

original: 'di ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: This is the perfection of patience.

original: 'di ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin no //
translated: This is not the perfection of patience.

original: 'di ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: This is the perfection of diligence.

original: 'di ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin no; ;'di ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin no; ;'di ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: This is not the perfection of diligence. This is the perfection of concentration.

original: 'di ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin no //
translated: This is not the perfection of concentration.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: This is the perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattvas.

original: 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa @166a *//
analyzed: 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa @166a *//
translated: This is the perfection of wisdom.

original: ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin no //
translated: This is not the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i thabs mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i thabs mkhas pa'o //
translated: This is the skillful means of the bodhisattvas.

original: 'di ni thabs mkhas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni thabs mkhas pa ma yin no //
translated: This is not skillful means.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa'o //
translated: This is the faultlessness of the bodhisattvas.🔽This is a fault.

original: 'di ni skyon du 'gyur ba'o; ;zhes bya bar chos de dag la mngon par chags shing gnas te 'du shes pa 'di ni /
analyzed: 'di ni skyon du 'gyur ba'o; ;zhes bya bar chos de dag la mngon par chags shing gnas te 'du shes pa 'di ni /
translated: ’ In this way, they become attached to those dharmas, abide in them, and conceptualize them.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i mthun pa'i chos la sred ba ste skyon du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i mthun pa'i chos la sred ba ste skyon du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: This is the craving for the concordant Dharma of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas, which is a fault.

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
translated: Śāriputra said, “Venerable Subhūti,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i skyon med pa gang yin /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i skyon med pa gang yin /
translated: what is the faultlessness of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas?”

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti replied,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: “Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /🔽nang stong pa nyid la phyi stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe / nang stong pa nyid la phyi stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: Here, Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,🔽they do not see external emptiness in internal emptiness,

original: phyi stong pa nyid la nang stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /🔽phyi stong pa nyid la phyi nang stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //🔽phyi nang stong pa nyid la phyi stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /🔽phyi nang stong pa nyid la stong pa nyid stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: phyi stong pa nyid la nang stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong / phyi stong pa nyid la phyi nang stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo // phyi nang stong pa nyid la phyi stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong / phyi nang stong pa nyid la stong pa nyid stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: they do not see internal emptiness in external emptiness,🔽and they do not see external emptiness in internal and external emptiness.🔽They do not see internal and external emptiness in external emptiness,🔽they do not see internal and external emptiness in the emptiness of emptiness,

original: stong pa nyid stong pa nyid la phyi nang stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: stong pa nyid stong pa nyid la phyi nang stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: and they do not see the emptiness of emptiness in internal and external emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid stong pa nyid la chen po stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: stong pa nyid stong pa nyid la chen po stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: They do not see the emptiness of emptiness in the emptiness of great emptiness,🔽and they do not see the emptiness of great emptiness in the emptiness of emptiness.

original: chen po stong pa nyid la stong pa nyid stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: chen po stong pa nyid la stong pa nyid stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: They do not see the emptiness of great extent in the emptiness of emptiness.

original: chen po stong pa nyid la don dam pa stong pa nyid @166b yang dag par rjes su mi mthong //
analyzed: chen po stong pa nyid la don dam pa stong pa nyid @166b yang dag par rjes su mi mthong //
translated: They do not see the emptiness of ultimate reality in the emptiness of great extent.

original: don dam pa stong pa nyid la chen po stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /🔽don dam pa stong pa nyid la 'dus byas stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: don dam pa stong pa nyid la chen po stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong / don dam pa stong pa nyid la 'dus byas stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: They do not see the emptiness of great extent in the emptiness of ultimate reality.🔽They do not see the emptiness of conditioned phenomena in the emptiness of ultimate reality.

original: 'dus byas stong pa nyid la don dam pa stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /🔽'dus byas stong pa nyid la 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /🔽'dus ma byas stong pa nyid la 'dus byas stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: 'dus byas stong pa nyid la don dam pa stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong / 'dus byas stong pa nyid la 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong / 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid la 'dus byas stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: They do not see the emptiness of ultimate reality in the emptiness of conditioned phenomena.🔽They do not see the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena in the emptiness of conditioned phenomena.🔽They do not see the emptiness of conditioned phenomena in the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena.

original: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid la thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid la thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: They do not see the emptiness of what is beyond extremes in the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena.

original: thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid la 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid la 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: They do not consider the emptiness of the conditioned to be the emptiness of the unconditioned.🔽They do not consider the emptiness of the unconditioned to be the emptiness of the conditioned.

original: thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid la dor ba med pa stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /🔽dor ba med pa stong nyid la thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /🔽dor ba med pa stong pa nyid la mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid la dor ba med pa stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong / dor ba med pa stong nyid la thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong / dor ba med pa stong pa nyid la mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: They do not consider the emptiness of the conditioned to be the emptiness of what is not to be discarded.🔽They do not consider the emptiness of what is not to be discarded to be the emptiness of the conditioned.🔽They do not consider the emptiness of what is not to be discarded to be the emptiness of the unconditioned.🔽They do not consider the emptiness of the unconditioned to be the emptiness of what is not to be discarded.

original: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid la dor ba med pa stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /🔽mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid la rang bzhin stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid la dor ba med pa stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong / mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid la rang bzhin stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: They do not consider the emptiness of what is not to be discarded to be the emptiness of the extreme.🔽They do not consider the emptiness of the extreme to be the emptiness of what is not to be discarded.🔽They do not consider the emptiness of the extreme to be the emptiness of nature.

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid la mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid la mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: They do not consider the emptiness of nature to be the emptiness of the extreme.

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid la rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid la rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: They do not see the emptiness of defining characteristics in the emptiness of nature.🔽They do not see the emptiness of nature

original: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid la @167a *//🔽rang bzhin stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid la @167a *// rang bzhin stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: in the emptiness of defining characteristics.🔽They do not see the emptiness of all phenomena

original: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid la chos thams cad stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid la chos thams cad stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: in the emptiness of defining characteristics.🔽They do not see the emptiness of defining characteristics

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid la rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid la rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: in the emptiness of all phenomena.🔽They do not see the emptiness of nonobservation

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid la mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid la mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: in the emptiness of all phenomena.🔽They do not see the emptiness of all phenomena

original: mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid la chos thams cad stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid la chos thams cad stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: in the emptiness of nonobservation.🔽They do not see the emptiness of nonthings

original: mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid la dngos po med pa stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid la dngos po med pa stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: in the emptiness of nonobservation.

original: dngos po med pa stong pa nyid la mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: dngos po med pa stong pa nyid la mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: They do not see the emptiness of nonapprehension in the emptiness of the nonexistence of things.

original: dngos po med pa stong pa nyid la ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: dngos po med pa stong pa nyid la ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: They do not see the emptiness of intrinsic nature in the emptiness of the nonexistence of things.

original: ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la dngos po med pa stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /🔽ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la dngos po med pa stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong / ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: They do not see the emptiness of the nonexistence of things in the emptiness of intrinsic nature.🔽They do not see the emptiness of intrinsic nature in the emptiness of the nonexistence of things.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: They do not see the emptiness of the intrinsic nature of nonthings in the emptiness of intrinsic nature.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod na /
translated: when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom in that way,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par 'jug go //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par 'jug go //
translated: they enter into the maturity of a bodhisattva.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: “Moreover, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: @167b rnam pa 'di ltar bslab par bya ste /
analyzed: @167b rnam pa 'di ltar bslab par bya ste /
translated: should train like this:

original: slob pa'i tshe ci nas kyang gzugs shes par bya ste /
analyzed: slob pa'i tshe ci nas kyang gzugs shes par bya ste /
translated: ‘While training, I will know form,

original: gzugs des rlom sems su mi bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs des rlom sems su mi bya'o //
translated: but I will not be conceited about that form.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa shes par bya ste /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa shes par bya ste /
translated: I will know feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness,

original: tshor ba de dang / 'du shes de dang / 'du byed de dang / rnam par shes pa des rlom sems su mi bya'o //
analyzed: tshor ba de dang / 'du shes de dang / 'du byed de dang / rnam par shes pa des rlom sems su mi bya'o //
translated: but I will not be conceited about that feeling, that perception, those volitional factors, or that consciousness.

original: mig shes par bya ste /
analyzed: mig shes par bya ste /
translated: I will know the eyes,

original: mig des rlom sems su mi bya'o //
analyzed: mig des rlom sems su mi bya'o //
translated: but I will not be conceited about those eyes.

original: rna ba dang / sna dang; lce dang / lus dang / yid shes par bya ste /
analyzed: rna ba dang / sna dang; lce dang / lus dang / yid shes par bya ste /
translated: I will know the ears, nose, tongue, body, and thinking mind,

original: des rlom sems su mi bya'o //
analyzed: des rlom sems su mi bya'o //
translated: but I will not be conceited about them.

original: gzugs shes par bya ste /
analyzed: gzugs shes par bya ste /
translated: I will know a form,

original: des rlom sems su mi bya'o //
analyzed: des rlom sems su mi bya'o //
translated: but I will not be conceited about it.

original: sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg dang / chos shes par bya ste /
analyzed: sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg dang / chos shes par bya ste /
translated: They should know sounds, smells, tastes, textures, and mental phenomena,

original: des rlom sems su mi bya'o //
analyzed: des rlom sems su mi bya'o //
translated: but they should not become proud on that account.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa shes par bya ste /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa shes par bya ste /
translated: They should know visual consciousness,

original: des rlom sems su mi bya'o //
analyzed: des rlom sems su mi bya'o //
translated: but they should not become proud on that account.

original: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa shes par bya ste /
analyzed: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa shes par bya ste /
translated: They should know auditory, olfactory, gustatory, tactile, and mental consciousness,

original: des rlom sems su mi bya'o //
analyzed: des rlom sems su mi bya'o //
translated: but they should not become proud on that account.

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa shes par bya ste /
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa shes par bya ste /
translated: They should know visual contact,

original: des rlom sems su mi bya'o //
analyzed: des rlom sems su mi bya'o //
translated: but they should not become proud on that account.

original: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa shes par bya ste /
analyzed: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa shes par bya ste /
translated: They should know auditory, olfactory, gustatory, tactile, and mental contact,

original: des rlom sems su mi bya'o //
analyzed: des rlom sems su mi bya'o //
translated: but they should not become proud on that account.

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba shes par bya ste /
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba shes par bya ste /
translated: They should know the feeling that arises from the condition of visual contact,

original: des rlom sems su mi bya'o //
analyzed: des rlom sems su mi bya'o //
translated: but they should not become proud on that account.

analyzed: tshor ba dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba shes par bya ste; des rlom sems su mi bya'o //
translated: the feeling that arises from the condition of the contact of the tongue, the feeling that arises from the condition of the contact of the body, and the feeling that arises from the condition of the contact of the mind, but they should not become proud on that account.

original: sa'i khams shes par bya ste /
analyzed: sa'i khams shes par bya ste /
translated: They should understand the earth element,

original: des rlom sems su mi bya'o //
analyzed: des rlom sems su mi bya'o //
translated: but they should not become proud on that account.

original: chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams shes par bya ste /
analyzed: chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams shes par bya ste /
translated: They should understand the water element, the fire element, the wind element, the space element, and the consciousness element,

original: des rlom sems su mi bya'o //
analyzed: des rlom sems su mi bya'o //
translated: but they should not become proud on that account.

original: ma rig pa shes par bya ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa shes par bya ste /

original: des rlom sems su mi bya'o //
analyzed: des rlom sems su mi bya'o //
translated: but they should not become proud on that account.

original: 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang / gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang / rga shi shes par bya ste /

analyzed: des rlom sems su mi bya'o //

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa des rlom sems su mi bya'o //

analyzed: nang stong pa nyid shes par bya ste /
